prompt: Identify the opinion and the reason.
script: As a matter of fact, I'm finding the new schedule quite helpful. At first, I was worried we wouldn't have enough time for lunch. It turns out that taking shorter, more frequent breaks keeps my energy up. Consequently, I feel much more productive in the afternoon.

options: To introduce the logical benefit they experience from the new schedule.
To complain that they are working too hard in the afternoon.
To demand even longer breaks from their manager.
To apologize for being unproductive at work.

explanation: The speaker uses 'Consequently' to show the positive result that comes directly from their new break routine.
